text: [Applause]
[Music]
hi there my name is Joshi and I'm a
technical support associate here at the
aw's office in Bangalore today I'm going
to talk about Amazon elastic computer
Cloud reserved instances a pricing model
for Amazon ec2 let's get started
reserved instances are the pricing
contracts that let AWS customers save up
to
72% over on demand E2 instance cost for
a one year or a three-year
commitment reserved instances areen
physical instances instead there are
billing discount applied to the use of
on demand instances running on your
account they can also be shared between
multiple accounts within a consolidated
bilding
family from the a Management console
navigate to the ec2
console then select reserved instances
from the navigation pane on the
left the E2 instances are charged at the
discounted reserved instance price if
the attributes of the r match the
attributes of the on demand instance
these attributes include in
types
platform tency which refers to Hardware
an instance can be set to default or a
dedicated
tency scope all reserved instances are
specific to a region but you can also
specify an availability Zone within a
region reserved instances not only offer
a discount but also all for continuous
capacity reservations when assigned to a
specific availability
Zone you can choose between three
payment options when you purchase a
reserved instance all up front partial
upfront and no
upfront if you choose the partial or no
upfront payment option the remaining
balance will be due and monthly
increments over the term
if your Computing needs change during
the term you might be able to modify or
exchange your reserved instance
depending on the offering
class standard reserved instances
provide the most significant discount
and offer limited modification whereas
the convertible reserved instances
provide a lower
discount however convert able reserved
instances can be exchanged for another
convertible reserved instance with
different instance
attributes thanks for watching and happy
cloud computing from all of us here at
AWS
[Applause]
[Music]
[Music]
